text: Chicago is a cue sport. It is a variation of rotation pool in which the balls are placed in positions against the rails of the table. The game is generally subject to betting by those playing and those watching. According to A Complete Hand-book of Standard Rules made in 1910, in Chicago Pool the lowest scorer "pays for the general refreshments", while the second-lowest scorer pays for the table.A Complete Hand-book of Standard Rules of all the prominent games of Billiards and Pool , (1910) New York: The Brunswick-Balke-Collender Company p.71. The pool hall Chicago Billiards in New Haven, Connecticut is named after the game. ==References== Category:Pool (cue sports)
